metadata.title: CVE-2011-1675 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
mount in util-linux 2.19 and earlier attempts to append to the/etc/mtab.tmp file without first checking whether resource limits wouldinterfere, which allows local users to trigger corruption of the /etc/mtabfile via a process with a small RLIMIT_FSIZE value, a related issue toCVE-2011-1089.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 1:2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libblkid1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libmount1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libuuid1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
mount - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
util-linux - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
util-linux-locales - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
uuid-runtime - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4').
util-linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4').
